course.subject: IELM
course.name: Manufacturing Processes
course.description: Machine tools, tools and tooling. Machining, fabrication, joining, assembly, and welding. Experiments in cutting tool performance involving tool geometry, speed, surface finish, tool life and production economics associated with those variables. Concepts of NC, CNC.

reviews.author: kkyy
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course is interesting to be honest, it taught basic idea of manufacturing process, and 3D illustrator software like CATIA 3D
reviews.comment_teaching: Ajay did give us as many examples as he could to better convey us the idea of industrial manufacture but it did not help a lot in homework and in tutorial. I had no idea about the calculation in homework and in examination. You have better do concept idealization yourself. TA did not help a lot to be honest.
reviews.comment_grading: If you are genius and smart enough, I think you can get pretty good grade in this course. Examinations and homework are very difficult, you have to do extra research to help finish 20% of them.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite heavy workload, midterm, final, 4-5 homework and 3 group projects with multiple tutorials.

reviews.author: Jolene
reviews.comment_content: The content of this class is actually interesting, you get to learn about manufacturing processes and how they are used in real life, and some of the labs are quite cool like making puzzles.
reviews.comment_teaching: I think the lecture component is poorly organized; Ajay tries to give examples from real life but he ends up jumping around to tangents and it's hard to find and focus on the important stuff he's trying to teach. Lab teaching is also poor; the TA explicitly said he received little help when he was a student learning this material, so he wanted our class to have the same experience... instead of helping us. As our lab instructor.
reviews.comment_grading: I was above/below mean probably equally on assignments in this class and ended with a C+. The means on assignments are low because nothing really matches what you learned in class, for example homework is unreasonable to complete given what you learn from class so the means on homeworks are around 30%.
reviews.comment_workload: If you just want to pass it's not bad; you'll need to work harder to do well though. A few homeworks, roughly weekly labs, and a project at the end.

reviews.author: vs
reviews.title: I found it hard
reviews.comment_content:
Material properties, surface treatment, casting, cutting, joining, welding, cutting process economics & optimization (for instance, most optimal steps to cut some desired shape out of a wooden workpiece) etc in lectures.

Labs - cutting, design, measurements, optimization (Excel Solver), project where students design a CAD model that showcases a manufacturing process in pairs, which is later 3d printed and assessed.

Project - submit all CAD files and final 3d printed product. Maybe some students actually milled their pieces out of aluminum? <- highly doubt this though
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ajay is cool. Knows his shit. Talks a lot, enthusiastic, doesn't cover a textbook per se (although there are reference copies in the library). Asks random Qs in class, if you can answer them more power to you

His slides are very sparse in complete sentences though, mostly Googled images, so your best bet is to take lengthy notes in class. Go to class my dudes
reviews.comment_grading:
I generally have a tough time in Ajay's courses, but I learn a lot. Grading is tough, as the course is tough (or maybe I'm dumb)

40% lab + project work, optional 5% participation, 25% * 2 exams, remainder homework. Exams are closed book, expect at least one quantitative Q (mechanics related, usually), two hours, non-cumulative, work through the Qs quickly because there are a lot of them

Ajay says to understand and appreciate things conceptually, but that's not enough. TA and prof both perceive course contents to be easy, maybe that is the case, but exams are hard... (again, could just be my stupidity)

Even though less than 10 students take the course, it's not an easy grade ;(
reviews.comment_workload: Pretty high for homework initially, as they are tough and you need to consolidate knowledge before delving into the problems. Later homework sets (i.e. ones after midterm) are slightly easier.
